main event: A dull grey circular object was observed flying in a straight and level flight near Seligman, New Mexico on 30 June 1949.
interesting points: The object was visible for 8 seconds before disappearing from sight., The observer estimated the object's speed at 2000 mph or faster., The observer described the object as having no apparent sound of power., The object was seen at an altitude estimated to be 10,000 feet., The sighting took place in perfectly clear weather conditions.
witness description: The observer was a vet meat inspector with the U.S. Department of Agriculture, reportedly well-educated and steady.
